title: Moderate california earthquake jars memories of earlier damage
author: Ap
text: COALINGA, Calif. _ When an earthquake rumbled through town yesterday, some residents said they feared they were facing a reprise of the 1983 quake that injured dozens, destroyed homes and caused $31 million in damage        ``I thought before the shaking stopped this was it: the California nightmare. That here goes everything again,'' said Jeff Thompson, 43, whose mobile home north of town was shaken off its foundations during the 1983 temblor, which measured 6.7 on the Richter scale.        But damage was light from the Friday-the-13th earthquake, which registered 5.0 on the scale.        Friday's earthquake struck about six miles northeast of town, said Robert Finn, a spokesman for the California Institute of Technology. He said it was an aftershock of the quake four years ago, and there could be more.
